item.title: Dead by Daylight Devs Address Nerfed Bloodpoints Accusations
item.description:
After recent reports that Dead by Daylight players are receiving fewer bloodpoints than usual, a developer has come forward to address this concern. During anniversary events such as the Twisted Masquerade, players are eligible to receive a special anniversary cake that will give them additional bloodpoints in a match. In years past, this cake has appeared randomly up to 2-3 times per match, and fans have noticed that it is appearing far less frequently than usual following a recent update to Dead by Daylight .

Despite frustration with this potential change to the formula, Dead by Daylight is currently breaking player records, indicating that it might not be a dealbreaker for everyone. Of course, much of the game's success can also be attributed to its many collaborations with other franchises, such as Stranger Things , Silent Hill , Alien , and Five Nights at Freddy's. It's entirely possible for fans to appreciate one aspect of the game and to be upset with another detail simultaneously.

After releasing the 9.0.2 Bugfix Patch, a Dead by Daylight developer on Reddit confirmed that players are receiving the number of cakes intended, implying that the way anniversary cakes work has fundamentally changed. This revelation was met with negative comments and reactions from fans who were frustrated with what was initially thought to be a bug; players hoping to see the issue fixed instead discovered that this would be the new norm for anniversary cakes going forward. That said, this is far from the first time that Dead by Daylight developers changed the formula, either through gameplay elements or how perks are earned.

Dead by Daylight Developer Confirms “Cakes Are Appearing as Intended”

This news definitely comes as a shock to players who weren't expecting such a change, and unfortunately the subject did not come up when Dead by Daylight developers discussed future plans for the franchise recently. While frustrated fans on Reddit had a lot to say about this comment, the most common refrain focused on how this change will make grinding for bloodpoints more stressful and difficult.

It seems that Behaviour Interactive are quite happy to keep the difficulty level of accruing bloodpoints in Dead by Daylight relatively high, and the developers don't view it as a problem. While hundreds of fans have already responded negatively, it remains to be seen if this change will create a major backlash. Regardless of whether the change to anniversary cakes was intended, it's fair to say that the developers could have chosen a more polite way to reveal this detail to its player base.

Your comment has not been saved

item.title: 6 Best Shooters With A Female Protagonist, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Wolfenstein: Youngblood features trigger-happy twins injecting Gen Z chaos into Nazi-slaying mayhem.
  • Returnal's Selene navigates a nightmare planet with psychological terror, unraveling sanity with each death.
  • Resident Evil 3 Remake puts Jill Valentine in the gritty, action-hero spotlight with unflinching determination.

There’s something unforgettable about charging into battle with a heroine who doesn’t just hold her own, but takes the spotlight and absolutely owns it. While female leads are still sorely underrepresented in shooter games , the ones who do show up tend to leave a mark that lasts way beyond the final mission. These six shooters don’t just deliver tight gunplay and inventive action, but they do it through female protagonists who are complex, compelling, and, frankly, cooler than most of their male counterparts.

And no, they’re not just “strong female characters.” They’re women written with depth, style, and purpose, and they fit their games like a hand in a fingerless, blood-slicked glove.

6 Wolfenstein: Youngblood

You Can’t Spell Mayhem Without M.A.Y.

5 Images
5 Images
Wolfenstein: Youngblood
6.7 /10
Released
July 26, 2019

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ // Blood and Gore, Game Experience May Change During Online Play, Intense Violence, Strong Language
Powered by

Wolfenstein: Youngblood takes the brutality of Nazi-slaying and injects it with a dose of Gen Z chaos, thanks to the Blazkowicz twins, Jess and Soph. These daughters of B.J. Blazkowicz aren’t just clones of their father in leather jackets; they’re loud, brash, trigger-happy maniacs who giggle through gunfights and drop one-liners with all the grace of a sledgehammer.

Set in an alternate 1980s Paris drenched in neon and fascism, the game ditches the series' usual stoicism and leans into co-op-centered fun. And while the story lacks the weight of The New Colossus , the gunplay is punchy and the upgrade system, where players spec into abilities like cloaking or extra melee damage, adds layers to the carnage. Whether players choose Soph or Jess, the experience is the same: a firestorm of bullets, sass, and sisterhood.

5 Returnal

Housemarque’s Bullet-Hell Existential Crisis

5 Images
5 Images
Returnal
10 /10
8.9 /10
Released
April 30, 2021

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T for Teen: Blood, Mild Language, Violence
Powered by

There’s a reason Returnal is often described as one of the most psychologically brutal games on PlayStation 5. It’s not just the punishing roguelike mechanics, but the fact that Selene Vassos, a middle-aged space pilot with a deadpan voice and a haunted past, is unraveling her sanity with every death.

The planet Atropos is less a battleground and more a waking nightmare, a hostile architecture, biomechanical horrors, and a looping time structure where Selene keeps finding her own corpses. Worse still, she’s not a soldier or chosen one; she’s a scout trying to make sense of a cosmic horror story that actively hates her. The game’s third-person shooting leans heavily on quick reflexes, tight dodging, and layering weapon traits across each run, but it’s Selene’s cold determination that makes the experience sting. She's not trying to save the world—she just wants out.

4 Resident Evil 3 Remake

One City. One Monster. One Girl With A Rocket Launcher.

Resident Evil 3
7 /10
8.3 /10
Released
April 3, 2020

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Strong Language
Powered by

When Resident Evil 3 Remake dropped in 2020, it gave Jill Valentine the gritty, action-hero spotlight she deserved. She’s no stranger to bio-organic terror — this is the same Jill who helped found the BSAA after surviving the Spencer Mansion — but this game strips away the team dynamics and leaves her alone in Raccoon City with Nemesis breathing down her neck.

Jill’s design was overhauled from her Resident Evil 3: Nemesis tube top days into something more grounded but still stylish, all the while being fit for combat. The gameplay leans more towards action than survival horror, offering a dodge mechanic that rewards perfect timing with bullet-time counters. However, what really elevates Jill here is her unshakable grit. Whether she’s blasting her way through burning alleyways or staring down a mutated bioweapon with a grenade launcher, Jill doesn’t flinch. She's not waiting for backup, as she is the backup.

3 Tomb Raider

Lara Croft Didn’t Just Survive—She Killed Her Way There

Tomb Raider
9 /10
8.3 /10
Released
March 5, 2013

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ Due To Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Strong Language
Powered by

By the time Tomb Raider (2013) rebooted the iconic archaeologist, Lara Croft was long overdue for a reimagining. Gone was the unflappable, wisecracking action figure from the PS1 era. This Lara bleeds, breaks, and screams, but she also learns. Fast.

What starts as a desperate attempt to survive a shipwreck turns into an origin story written in blood. The island of Yamatai is full of cultists, deadly animals, and ruins packed with environmental puzzles. And while the bow gets most of the credit for her new combat style, Lara is equally deadly with pistols, shotguns, and explosives. Her progression from frightened survivor to efficient killer is a bit uncomfortable, but that’s the point. This Lara doesn't stumble into greatness, but she crawls through hell to get there.

2 Control

In This Federal Bureau, The Boss Wears Red

6 Images
6 Images
Control
9 /10
7.6 /10
Released
August 27, 2019

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ // Mature: Blood, Strong Language, Violence
Powered by

Control doesn’t just give players a gun, but it gives them the Service Weapon, a reality-warping firearm that shifts forms mid-combat. And Jesse Faden isn’t just another action hero with a troubled past. She’s the new Director of the Federal Bureau of Control, a secret government agency buried inside the endlessly warping halls of the Oldest House.

Jesse’s calm but curious demeanor grounds the game’s chaos. One minute she’s talking to a sentient light switch that teleports her to an interdimensional motel, the next she’s hurling chunks of concrete at mind-controlled agents using telekinesis. What makes her stand out is how natural it all feels. She’s thrown into a world of cosmic weirdness, floating corpses, and cryptic janitors, but she rolls with it. The gunplay is tight, but it’s Jesse’s powers — and her matter-of-fact leadership in an unraveling reality — that make her unforgettable.

1 Metroid Prime 2: Echoes

Samus Doesn't Speak Much. She Doesn’t Need To

6 Images
6 Images
Metroid Prime 2: Echoes
10.0 /10
Released
November 15, 2004

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

ESRB
T For Teen Due To Animated Blood, Violence
Powered by

In Metroid Prime 2: Echoes , Samus Aran steps into one of the series’ most visually distinct settings, Aether, a planet split into light and dark dimensions. What’s fascinating about Samus in this game isn’t just that she’s a bounty hunter in a power suit, but it’s that she remains almost entirely silent and alone throughout, yet feels more commanding than most voice-acted protagonists.

The gameplay is a blend of first-person shooting and exploration-heavy puzzle solving, with an emphasis on scanning environments and shifting between the Light and Dark worlds to progress. Every upgrade, from the Dark Beam to the Screw Attack, reinforces the sense that Samus is mastering a world that’s constantly trying to kill her. And in true Metroid fashion, she doesn’t do it for glory. She doesn’t even flinch. Samus is pure competence—no drama, no speeches, just calculated survival and overwhelming firepower in the face of a world literally splitting itself apart.

item.title: Sparkle Team Composition Guide In Honkai Star Rail
item.description:
Sparkle

Quantum

Harmony

5-Star

Guides

Build Guide

Level-Up Materials

Team Composition

Best Light Cone

Back to All Characters

Sparkle is a playable Harmony character in Honkai: Star Rail . Her gameplay is also quite great, with unique support abilities such as generating skill points, as well as providing damage and Crit DMG buffs, and Advance Forward mechanics similar to Bronya. That being the case, Sparkle can fit into many team compositions, depending on the needs of the team.

Sparkle becomes very useful when the team needs Skill Points management, or when there are several Quantum characters in the team. That’s because Sparkle can generate Skill Points with her Ultimate while her passive provides a team-wide ATK% buff based on how many Quantum units are in her team. Here are some of Sparkle's best team compositions in Honkai: Star Rail .

Updated on July 4, 2025, by Nahda Nabiilah: With many new characters joining the HSR roster, especially Archer, this list will be updated to include new Sparkle team comps in HSR .

6 Sparkle + Archer + Cipher + Huohuo

Archer can regenerate skill points as a part of his kit, but he'll eventually keep consuming them, making him a very SP-hungry unit. That’s why Sparkle is the perfect character for his team. First, Sparkle fully buffs Archer because of their shared Quantum element. She also regenerates a lot of skill points with her Ultimate, allowing Archer to have a lot of SP for his Skill.

Since this Sparkle team needs characters that consume minimum skill points, Cipher can sit at the side, recording the DPS while debuffing enemies with her passive. When the time is right, unleash her Ultimate, and Cipher will deal a massive amount of DMG to Archer’s target. At the same time, Huohuo acts as an emergency healer, where she will only use her Skill if the team needs healing. She’s important for this team because her Ultimate gives Archer and Cipher an ATK% buff alongside regenerating the team’s energy.

5 Sparkle + C2 Acheron + Jiaoqiu + Gallagher

Once Acheron gets her C2, she doesn’t need two Nihility units in her team anymore, which clears the spot for buffers like Sparkle to join the team. The team will then work perfectly, as Sparkle will actively keep advancing Acheron’s action while granting her tons of buffs. On the other hand, Jiaoqiu keeps enemies debuffed, maximizing Acheron’s Nihility passive.

The beautiful thing about teaming Sparkle with Acheron is that Sparkle will always advance her action, which Acheron will use to gain more Ultimate stacks. Sparkle will also keep the skill points overflowing, allowing Jiaoqiu and Gallagher to use their skills more comfortably. Instead of building Jiaoqiu’s Ultimate with his Basic ATK, players can spam his Skill. Finally, Gallagher works as a healer for the team while debuffing enemies on each attack, which will make him a decent Acheron battery.

If unavailable, Jiaoqiu can be swapped for Silver Wolf, Cipher, or Pela. Meanwhile, Gallagher can be replaced by Preservation characters like Aventurine.

4 Sparkle + Dan Heng Imbibitor Lunae + Ruan Mei + Luocha

When players think of a skill point-heavy character, one of the first DPS characters that comes to mind is Dan Heng Imbibitor Lunae (DHIL), since he requires up to three skill points to fully enhance his Basic ATK. Considering that Sparkle is heavily skill point-positive, when combined with another buffing support like Ruan Mei, as well as Luocha for sustain that are also skill point positive, Dan Heng Imbibitor Lunae can consistently deal massive damage without needing to worry about any skill point management. Especially if Sparkle's Speed is built to be over 160, players can further optimize Dan Heng Imbibitor Lunae's other stats without needing Speed boots.

3 Sparkle + Seele + Silver Wolf + Fu Xuan

Sparkle is also an ideal character for mono-Quantum team compositions, as she benefits most from having at least 3 Quantum characters in the team. Therefore, if players plan to buff their Seele's utility and damage further, Sparkle is undoubtedly the best Harmony character to include in her team compositions. Especially when paired with other Quantum characters like Silver Wolf, who can ensure the application of Quantum weakness to any enemy, and a sustain character like Fu Xuan, who can further buff the team's Crit Rate, even players who have not invested heavily in min-maxing Seele's Crit Ratios will benefit greatly from the synergy provided by these characters.

It's also worth mentioning that while Seele isn't as skill-point-heavy as DHIL, she still benefits from Sparkle's skill point recovery, considering that she mainly focuses on her Skill and Ultimate to deal damage. In instances where opponents have Quantum weakness already, players may also want to consider replacing Silver Wolf with Pela.

2 Sparkle + Jing Yuan + Tingyun + Huohuo

While it may not be as apparent at first glance as with Seele or DHIL, another character that can benefit well from Sparkle's buffs is Jing Yuan, especially thanks to the Advance Forward mechanic, which ensures that he can stack Lightning Lord as quickly as possible. In this team composition, Tingyun remains one of the best support characters for Jing Yuan, further increasing his ATK and enabling his Ultimates as much as possible. For the last spot, players can essentially use any sustain character they have access to; however, Tingyun and Huohuo can have added synergy for even further ATK boost and Energy Regeneration, resulting in a significant boost to Jing Yuan's ATK while Sparkle focuses on boosting his DMG and Crit DMG as well. Since the buffs last until Sparkle's next turn, it allows for Lightning Lord to retain the buffs even if he is much slower than the rest of the team.

1 Sparkle + Qingque + Asta + Lynx

For those looking for a more F2P-friendly team, considering the other options heavily rely on other 5-star characters, Sparkle also works very well with Qingque. This is because not only can Qingque benefit from Sparkle's ascension trait that allows for increased attack for Quantum characters, but she can also benefit significantly from the addition of skill points, as her basic attacks require some degree of RNG to be enhanced, especially if players do not have access to her sixth Eidolon. Other characters that work well include Asta with her ATK buffs, as well as Speed buff, which will come in handy if players require Sparkle to have more speed, and also Lynx, who will sustain the team while contributing to the Quantum character count to increase Sparkle's passive buff further. Overall, all of these 4-star characters are obtainable without relying on the Gacha, making it a considerable option, especially when tackling content like Pure Fiction, where Qingque, as an Erudition character, can work amazingly.

Your comment has not been saved

item.title: Roblox: Peroxide Codes (July 2025)
item.description:
Quick Links

  • All Peroxide Codes
  • How to Redeem Codes in Peroxide
  • How to Get More Peroxide Codes
  • Peroxide Tips and Tricks
  • The Best Roblox Anime Games Like Peroxide

There are plenty of great Roblox games that are inspired by manga and anime, but few, if any, are quite as good as Peroxide . As its name suggests, it's based on Tite Kubo's Bleach and offers players an incredibly enjoyable combat experience that Ichigo himself would be proud of. As in most other Roblox games, that experience can become even better with the help of Peroxide codes.

Players can redeem Peroxide codes to claim a ridiculous amount of free Product Essences, which they can then take to Kisuke in The City to get rerolls on every individual path. Product Essences can also be used to acquire cosmetic items, which is why fans of the game are always on the lookout for all of the latest Peroxide codes.

Updated July 5, 2025, by Tom Bowen: A brand-new Peroxide code was just added to celebrate American Independence Day. By redeeming 4thJuly2025 , players can get 15 free Product Essences . After doing so, they should take a moment or two to bookmark this page so that they can check back here often, as we're always on the lookout for new codes for Peroxide and will add any that we find to the list below.

How to Redeem Codes in Peroxide

As with similar Roblox games, the process of redeeming codes in Peroxide is relatively straightforward and does not require much knowledge or effort on the player's part. Even so, those having trouble can find step-by-step instructions on how to claim in-game rewards listed below:

  • First, it is necessary to launch Peroxide .
  • Then, if players are entering the game for the first time, they'll need to go through the tutorial.
  • Once the tutorial has been completed, in the upper left part of the screen, players should find and select the start button . It is located to the right of the chat button.
  • In the resulting menu, players should type or paste any of the active Peroxide codes listed above and then press Enter.

How to Get More Peroxide Codes

To get more Peroxide codes, players can subscribe to the developer's official Discord server, where they'll find news and updates about the game. However, the best solution is to bookmark this article, as it is updated every month.

Peroxide Tips and Tricks

Below, players will find some tips and tricks for Peroxide :

Shikai Unlocking

  • Reach level 15 as a Soul Reaper by completing quests on the board.
  • To defeat additional Hollows, visit Wake Up Mundo . It will cost 200 in-game currency.
  • Enhance stats by going to the gym near Kisuke or using agility boards.
  • After reaching level 15, meditate to unlock the Shikai.
  • Achieve B rank to use Shikai infinitely.

Resurrection Unlocking

  • Resurrection is automatically unlocked at level 15.

Use Crystals

  • Collect time relics to purchase crystals, which will enhance abilities.
  • Crystals can grant additional effects to attacks, such as setting enemies on fire.

Optimizing Stat Builds

  • Focus on combat stats rather than support stats.
  • Players need to choose stats based on their desired playstyle, whether it's a strength, vitality, or ability build.

The Best Roblox Anime Games Like Peroxide

Each game is special in its own way and offers an interesting gaming experience. That is why it is always fun for players to try something new. To that end, below is a list of the five best anime games like Peroxide :

  • Project Slayers
  • Anime Adventures
  • Blox Fruits
  • Titan Warfare
  • Type Soul

Q: What is the newest code in Peroxide?

The newest Peroxide codes are 4thJuly2025 and 400kLikesLOTM , which players can redeem to get 45 free Product Essences.

item.title: New York Times Connections Hints and Answers for #755 July 5, 2025
item.description:
Connections is here again to tease your mind with connections between some seemingly-unrelated words. In order to win, you will need to know a lot more than just the rules of Connections : you'll have to know all the words, all their possible definitions, and be able to figure out the categories too.

If you are stuck on this one and looking for a hand, you can find tons of clues in the article below. It will include everything from general puzzle clues to spoilers and more. No matter what you need to win, you can find it here.

Words in the NYT Connections Puzzle #755 for July 5, 2025

The Connections puzzle for today contains the words: Short, Pine, Fold, Laundry, Long, Bucket, Burn, Sting, To-Do, Scheme, Stir, Racket, Beat, Itch, Hustle, and Blend.

Hints for the NYT Connections Puzzle

If you want a little hint or a lot of them, you can find a bunch of different kinds of clues in the many sections below for this challenging puzzle game. Open each of them up to see what sort of help is hidden inside each one.

Some General Hints for the Whole Connections Puzzle

Want to play? Check out the New York Times Games Connections website available on almost any device with a browser.
